Subjective: Right eye redness and irritation x3 days. Feels like hair or dust in eye. Negatives: No vision changes, no light sensitivity, no pain except when squeezing eyes shut. No contact lens use. Social: Lives alone with daughter Isa, boyfriend away. Request: Wants to know if it's an infection and needs eye drops or antibiotics.
Objective: Right eye: Conjunctival redness, no foreign body seen, pupils reactive. Left eye: Mild redness starting.
Assessment: Viral conjunctivitis right eye, starting left eye. No signs of bacterial infection.
Plan: 1. Avoid rubbing eyes. 2. Artificial tears prn for comfort. 3. Clean with lukewarm tap water and cotton pad. 4. Safety net: Return if not resolved in 2 weeks, or sooner if pain, pus, or increased discharge. 5. Reassurance: Likely viral, self-limiting.
